title: Breaking Negative Thinking Patterns: A Schema Therapy
description:
Breaking Negative Thinking Patterns: A Schema Therapy Self-Help and Support Book by Gitta Jacob, Hannie van Genderen

Overview: Breaking Negative Thinking Patterns is the first schema-mode focused resource guide aimed at schema therapy patients and self-help readers seeking to understand and overcome negative patterns of thinking and behaviour.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Features a wealth of case studies that serve to clarify schemas and modes and illustrate techniques for overcoming dysfunctional modes and behavior patterns
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Offers a series of exercises that readers can immediately apply to real-world challenges and emotional problems as well as the complex difficulties typically tackled with schema therapy
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Includes original illustrations that demonstrate the modes and approaches in action, along with 20 self-help mode materials which are also available online
